programmes.show_description: Relax, unwind and chill out with an hour of classic and contemporary tunes.
See programme schedules for BBC Radio 5 Live.
The Aberystwyth Book Club discuss The Eleventh Hour by Salman Rushdie. These five works of fiction explore what it means to approach the eleventh hour of life.
The story of how a mysterious shipwreck off the wild coast of Ynys Môn in the mid 1730s led to the birth of a dynasty and a new field of medicine that spread around the world.
Daffodils for St David's Day from Pembrokeshire, and how artificial intelligence is supporting farm vets and helping protect curlew in rural Wales.
A special service of Choral Mattins to celebrate St David's Day from St Davids Cathedral.
Vaughan Roderick with political news, discussions and analysis, plus a review of the Sunday papers.
As part of the BBC's AI Unpacked Week, Azim Ahmed and a panel of guests unpack whether Artificial Intelligence belongs in our mosques, churches and temples.
A second dose of Owen Money for the weekend. It's nonstop music all the way, with classics from the 60s, 70s and 80s, plus your dedications!
Robin brings you the best in music and guests for your Sunday afternoon. Call 03700 100 110 Text 81012 or message us via X @bbcradiowales.
Music, entertainment and great guests for your Sunday afternoon.
Roys chats with Beverly Humphries about the Festival of Female Voices and talks to St. Davids Cathedral librarian Mari James about St. David.
Catrin Nye looks at the effects of tragedy on humans and on a community. Contains some scenes which some viewers may find upsetting.
A special service of Choral Mattins to celebrate St David's Day from St Davids Cathedral.
Frank Hennessy presents the best in folk, roots and acoustic music from the Celtic countries and beyond.
The finest musical melodies, exquisite performances from stage and screen, and orchestral and choral works from Wales and the world. There's no need to book your seat, just listen and relax.
See programme schedules for BBC Radio 5 Live.
The latest news and weather for Wales and a look ahead to this morning's Radio Wales Breakfast.
A lively mix of music to start the day. Perfect for your pod!
The Aberystwyth Book Club discuss The Eleventh Hour by Salman Rushdie. These five works of fiction explore what it means to approach the eleventh hour of life.
Everything you need to know as you wake up.
Bronwen brightens your morning with great music and entertainment. Call 03700 100 110 Text 81012 or message via X @bbcradiowales.
Be part of the nation's conversation.
Celebrity guests, TV Turn Ons, and we test your anagram-solving skills with The Name Game. Call or WhatsApp 03700 100 110 Text 81012.
Everything you need to know as you head home.
After the news crews leave, what happens next? Catrin Nye presents a series about the aftermath and the long-term effects of tragedy and trauma on humans and on a community.
Huw Stephens plays classic tracks, introduces his Artist of the Week and features new music from Wales and beyond.
Eleri brightens your night-time with great music and chat. Call 03700 100 110 Text 81012 or via X @bbcradiowales.
